means: [地名] 角（密克罗尼西亚语）
letter ： 最普通用词，泛指一切形式的书信，尤指邮寄的信。
note ： 指内容直截了当的短信或便条，正式或非正式均可。
correspondence ： 集合名词，指全部来往信件。
message ： 指书信、口信、电报等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"注意"之意。
means: notice ： 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。
mind ： 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
attend ： 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark ： 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。

sentence.Network_en: Somehow he tells these stories without a note of horror.
sentence.Network_cn: 不知为什么他讲这些故事时一点都不害怕。

sentence.Network_en: She scribbled a note to tell Mum she'dgone out.
sentence.Network_cn: 她匆匆写了个便条告诉妈妈她已外出。

sentence.Network_en: She had written him a note a couple of weeks earlier.
sentence.Network_cn: 她几周前给他写过一个便条。

phrase.cizu_name: hit (或 strike) the right (或 wrong) note

jx.jx_en_mean: say or do something in exactly the right (or wrong) way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 完全正确（或错误）地说（或做）某事

lj.lj_ly: many of his comments are worthy of note.
lj.lj_ls: 他的很多看法都值得重视。

lj.lj_ly: Roman historians of note include Livy, Tacitus, and Sallust.
lj.lj_ls: 著名的罗马历史学家包括李维、塔西佗和萨卢斯特。

lj.lj_ly: she greeted him gushingly, and that struck a false note.
lj.lj_ls: 她故作热情地跟他打招呼，反而显得很虚伪。

jx.jx_en_mean: express (a particular feeling or view) about something

lj.lj_ly: he sounded a note of caution about the trend towards health foods.
lj.lj_ls: 他对热衷保健食品的风潮表示谨慎。

lj.lj_ly: employers should &B{take note of} the needs of disabled people.
lj.lj_ls: 雇主应重视伤残人的需求。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 4 of the noun and sense 1 of the verb): from Old French note (noun), noter (verb), from Latin nota 'a mark', notare 'to mark'

entry.def: A note is a short letter.

example.ex: Stevens wrote him a note asking him to come to his apartment...
example.tran: 史蒂文斯给他写了张便条，请他去自己的公寓。

example.ex: I'll  have to leave a note for Karen.
example.tran: 我得给卡伦留张便条。

entry.def: A note is something that you write down to remind yourself of something.

example.ex: I knew that if I didn't make a note I would lose the thought so I asked to borrow a pen or pencil...
example.tran: 我知道如果我不把这个想法记下来就会忘记，所以我找人借了支笔。

example.ex: Take notes during the consultation as the final written report is very concise.
example.tran: 磋商的时候要作记录，因为最终的书面报告非常简洁。

entry.def: In a book or article, a note is a short piece of additional information.

example.ex: See Note 16 on p. 223.
example.tran: 参见第223页的注释16。

example.ex: ...'Exiles' by James Joyce, edited with an Introduction and notes by J C C Mays.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·乔伊斯的《流亡者》，由J.C.C. 梅斯作序并注释

entry.def: A note is a short document that has to be signed by someone and that gives official information about something.

example.ex: Since Mr Bennett was going to need some time off work, he asked for a sick note...
example.tran: 因为贝内特先生要请假一段时间，他请医生开了病假条。

example.ex: I've got half a ton of gravel in the lorry but he won't sign my delivery note.
example.tran: 我的卡车里装着半吨沙砾，但他不给我签收送货单。

entry.def: You can refer to a banknote as a note .

example.ex: They exchange traveller's cheques at a different rate from notes.
example.tran: 他们兑换旅行支票时依据的汇率跟兑换现钞时不同。

example.ex: ...a five pound note.
example.tran: 5英镑的纸币

entry.def: In music, a note is the sound of a particular pitch, or a written symbol representing this sound.

example.ex: She has a deep voice and doesn't  even try for the high notes...
example.tran: 她嗓音低沉，从没试过高音。

example.ex: If the note of D is sounded on a harp, all the corresponding D strings of other octaves will likewise resonate.
example.tran: 如果用竖琴演奏D音符，其他八度音阶所有相应的D弦都将发出共鸣。

entry.def: You can use note to refer to a particular quality in someone's voice that shows how they are feeling.

example.ex: There is an unmistakable note of nostalgia in his voice when he looks back on the early years of the family business...
example.tran: 他回忆早些年的家族生意时，无疑是带着一种怀旧的语气的。

example.ex: It was not difficult for him to catch the note of bitterness in my voice.
example.tran: 他不难听出我话语中的愤愤不平。

entry.def: You can use note to refer to a particular feeling, impression, or atmosphere.

example.ex: Yesterday's testimony began on a note of passionate but civilized disagreement...
example.tran: 昨天的作供是在激烈但文明地表达分歧的氛围中开始的。

example.ex: Somehow he tells these stories without a note of horror...
example.tran: 不知为什么他讲这些故事时一点都不害怕。

entry.def: If you note a fact, you become aware of it.

example.ex: The White House has noted his promise to support any attack that was designed to enforce the UN resolutions...
example.tran: 白宫已经注意到他承诺支持所有旨在贯彻联合国决议的打击。

example.ex: Suddenly, I noted that the rain had stopped...
example.tran: 突然，我意识到雨已经停了。

entry.def: If you tell someone to note something, you are drawing their attention to it.

example.ex: Note the statue to Sallustio Bandini, a prominent Sienese...
example.tran: 请看这座萨卢斯蒂奥·班迪尼的雕像，他是一位杰出的锡耶纳人。

example.ex: Please note that there are a limited number of tickets.
example.tran: 请注意，票的数量有限。

entry.def: If you note something, you mention it in order to draw people's attention to it.

example.ex: The report notes that export and import volumes picked up in leading economies...
example.tran: 报告特别指出经济大国的进出口量攀升。

example.ex: The yearbook also noted a sharp drop in reported cases of sexually transmitted disease.
example.tran: 年鉴同时指出，性传播疾病报告病例数显著下降。

entry.def: When you note something, you write it down as a record of what has happened.

example.ex: 'He has had his tonsils out and has been ill, too,' she noted in her diary...
example.tran: “他切除了扁桃体，一直病着，”她在日记里写道。

example.ex: One policeman was clearly visible noting the number plates of passing cars...
example.tran: 能清楚地看到一名警察记下了经过车辆的车牌号。

entry.def: If you compare notes with someone on a particular subject, you talk to them and find out whether their opinion, information, or experience is the same as yours.

example.ex: The women were busily comparing notes on the queen's outfit...
example.tran: 女人们忙着交换对女王衣着的看法。

example.ex: They exchanged greetings, compared notes on their wives and families, and finally got down to business.
example.tran: 他们互致问候，聊了聊家常，然后才言归正传。

entry.def: Someone or something that is of note is important, worth mentioning, or well-known.

example.ex: ...politicians of note...
example.tran: 政要

example.ex: He has published nothing of note in the last ten years.
example.tran: 他在过去的10年里没有发表任何有影响的作品。

entry.tran: 表达…的情感;带有…的印象;营造…的氛围
entry.def: If someone or something strikes a particular note or sounds a particular note, they create a particular feeling, impression, or atmosphere.

example.ex: Before his first round of discussions, Mr Baker sounded an optimistic note...
example.tran: 第一轮讨论前，贝克先生听上去还比较乐观。

example.ex: Plants growing out of cracks in paving strike the right note up a cottage-garden path.
example.tran: 从铺路石缝隙间长出的植物恰好营造出乡间农舍花园小径的感觉。

entry.def: If you take note of something, you pay attention to it because you think that it is important or significant.

example.ex: Take note of the weather conditions...
example.tran: 留心一下天气状况。

example.ex: They took note that she showed no surprise at the news of the murder.
example.tran: 他们注意到她对谋杀的消息一点都不感到惊讶。

sentences.sentence: "drop me a line when you get there"
"he made a note of the appointment"
"there was a note of gaiety in her manner"

means.word_mean: 4. a piece of paper money (especially one issued by a central bank);
5. a notation representing the pitch and duration of a musical sound;

sentences.sentence: "the singer held the note too long"
"his notes were appended at the end of the article"
"he added a short notation to the address on the envelope"

means.word_mean: 7. high status importance owing to marked superiority;
8. a tone of voice that shows what the speaker is feeling;

sentences.sentence: "there was a note of uncertainty in his voice"

means.word_mean: 9. a promise to pay a specified amount on demand or at a certain time;

sentences.sentence: "I had to co-sign his note at the bank"
"She observed that his presentation took up too much time"
"They noted that it was a fine day to go sailing"
"She noted that someone was following her"

means.word_mean: 3. observe with care or pay close attention to;

sentences.sentence: "she noted everything the teacher said that morning"

auth_sentence.content: Porn is not normal sex, the campaigners note.
auth_sentence.res_content: Porn is not normal sex, the campaigners note.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Porn is not normal sex, the campaigners note.

auth_sentence.content: In this there is a note of singular affirmation.
auth_sentence.res_content: In this there is a note of singular affirmation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In this there is a note of singular affirmation.

auth_sentence.content: Please note that unsuccessful applicants will not be contacted.
auth_sentence.res_content: Please note that unsuccessful applicants will not be contacted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Please note that unsuccessful applicants will not be contacted.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 显而易见的, 值得注意的
stems_affixes.word_buile: notice注意到,注意+able……的→adj.显而易见的, 值得注意的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 臭名昭著的,声名狼藉的
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+orious多……的→多惹人注意的→臭名昭著的
notorious[[adj.臭名昭著的,声名狼藉的]]→n.臭名昭彰
denote[v.指示,表示,意味着]+ation表名词→n.指示

stems_affixes.value_cn: 值得注意的,显著的,著名的
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+able能……的→n.值得注意的,显著的,著名的
not知道,注意,注释+e→n.笔记；注释 v.注意到
note笔记+book→n.笔记簿, 笔记本

stems_affixes.value_cn: 通知,通告,布告;注意,认识
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+ice表名词→n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识 v.注意到,注意

stems_affixes.value_cn: 概念,想法,意念,看法,观点
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+ion表名词→n.概念,想法,意念,看法,观点
de加强+not知道,注意,注释+e→指示
not知道,注意,注释+e→n.笔记；注释 v.注意到
not知道,注意,注释+ify表动词→给以注意→通知
not知道,注意,注释+ice表名词→n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识 v.注意到,注意

Sentence.sentence: Most students write questions or short notes in the margins.
By focusing on the notes in the margins
By comparing notes with their classmates.
Harry Lewis, noted in a blog post about his objections.

A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution
By recapturing the attempt of the monarch and noting where they came from, the next scientist can figure out things like butterfly's age and its routing

sentences.en: She sent him a note of thanks.
sentences.cn: 她寄给他一封简短的感谢信。

sentences.en: I took a careful note of where I had left the bag, so as to be sure to find it on my return.
sentences.cn: 我注意记住我把提包放在什么地方, 这样我回去时就肯定能找到它。

sentences.en: He presented a note to the British Government.
sentences.cn: 他向英国政府递交了一份函件。

sentences.en: There ought to be a note on this obsolete word.
sentences.cn: 这个过时的词应有注释。

sentences.en: The book ended on an optimistic note.
Here is a 5 dollars note for you.
A villager had noted the number of the truck.
sentences.cn: 一个村民记下了车牌号。

sentences.en: Please note that the movie starts at 7 o'clock.
sentences.cn: 请注意, 电影七点开映。

sentences.en: It should be noted that no one would like to take his place.
sentences.cn: 应该注意的是, 谁也不愿代替他的位置。

sentences.en: They noted David to be too clever.
sentences.cn: 他们注意到大卫过于聪明。

sentences.en: I noted a change come over his face.
sentences.cn: 我发觉他脸上的表情发生了变化。

jushi.english: I really couldn't understand the text — I had to refer to the notes at the back.
jushi.chinese: 我实在弄不懂正文,只得参看后面的注释。

jushi.english: Give me the change in notes.
Although the company still has some difficulties, the director's report ended on an optimistic note.
jushi.chinese: 虽然这公司仍有一些困难,但董事的报告是以乐观的调子结束的。
